jobDescription: Job DescriptionHilton is creating an industry-leading Data & Analytics team that turns data into insights and insights into decisions, leveraging a combination thought leadership and hospitable, business savvy problem solvers to reinvent the way we measure and impact our business.  The newly formed Data Strategy & Governance team supports key functions across the business by utilizing innovative solutions to provide frictionless and timely access to high-quality, integrated data. The team consists of experts in data governance, data quality, data integration, data modeling, and data channeling, reporting and dashboards.  As the Senior Analyst, Data Architecture, you will report to the Director, Data Architecture & API Library, and be responsible for making sure that the right data is modeled, shaped and available for consumption in the most efficient way, providing a one-stop shop for sourcing all enterprise data by managing the data models and APIs, and playing a key support role in data services, aligned by data domain. You will be supporting the construct, testing, and optimization of the data integration patterns between Hadoop and BI tools to maximum performance. You will also be supporting management of the Application Programming Interface (API) library.What will I be doing?The success in this role will demonstrate itself through: Highly governed, documented and enterprise-aware set of data models used for reporting, dashboards and analytics self-serviceEffective solution architecture support of the entire team for overall approach and methodology and final review of deliverablesSmart and efficient Big Data architecture approach and infrastructure for the projectsImplementation of data shapes following the architecture designsClose engagement with the BI team to optimize models and connection patterns for maximum performance As a Team Member in this role, you will be responsible for: Supporting data query needs from multiple stakeholders within the Center of Excellence (Dashboards, Analytics, and Data Science Pods) and in the businessSupporting the self-service capability of the business using drag and drop functionality within BI toolsWorking with Business Data Steward(s) and Information Technology (IT) Data Steward(s) to identify data elements needed to address downstream data requestsWorking with IT to define data sourcing and system integration requirements for downstream consumersCoordinating with the Information Integration team to ensure that meta-data is captured accuratelyDocumenting functional data integration requirements for ingestion of required data into the data lakeCoordinating with IT data architecture to define technical integration requirements to supply required source dataCoordinating with report automation team to validate data consumer requirements are met and that the right data is sourced from the lakeWorking with meta-data analysts to ensure data element lineage and other business and technical metadata is documented in the repositoryHelping manage the library of all deployed Application Programming Interface (API)sSupporting API documentation of classes, methods scenarios, code, design rationales, and contractsWhat are we looking for? To fulfill this role successfully, you must possess the following minimum qualifications and experience: Minimum Education: Associate's Degree/College Diploma/CepegMinimum Years of Experience: three (3) years in data integration and API managementMinimum Years of Experience: two (2) years in Analytics Programming LanguagesAdditional Requirements (i.e. % of travel time, etc.):o Expertise with BI tools including Tableau, MicroStrategy and the respective data integration patterns o Advanced Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint skills, and presentation skills o Minimum one (1) year of experience with Informatica, Talend, Alteryx, Apache Atlast, Cllibra, and other data management systems  It would be advantageous in this position for you to demonstrate the following capabilities and distinctions: Functional experience in hospitalityEnd-to-end understanding of the data flow process (from ingestion to consumption layer)Solid working experience with surrounding and supporting disciplines (data quality, data operations, BI/Data WH/Data Lake)Effective communicator, collaborator, influencer, solution seeker across variety of opinionsSelf-starter, well organized, extremely detail-oriented and an assertive team player, willing to take ownership of responsibilities, and possess a high level of positive energy and driveExcellent time management and organizational skillsAbility to manage multiple priorities, work well under pressure and effectively handle concurrent demands to prioritize responsibilitiesWhat will it be like to work for Hilton? Hilton is the leading global hospitality company, spanning the lodging sector from luxurious full-service hotels and resorts to extended-stay suites and mid-priced hotels. For nearly a century, Hilton has offered business and leisure travelers the finest in accommodations, service, amenities and value. Hilton is dedicated to continuing its tradition of providing exceptional guest experiences across its global brands. Our vision to fill the earth with the light and warmth of hospitality unites us as a team to create remarkable hospitality experiences around the world every day. And, our amazing Team Members are at the heart of it all!
